page.title: 20LANDSCAPES: SUMMARY
page.content:
The 12 square kilometres of study are undergoing considerable change as they are on the fringe of a large urban and industrial area. Within the study squares there is little employment, the pattern being that of two large dormitory settlements gradually eroding surrounding farmland. The villages have no particular centre, having expanded gradually in the past along main routeways, but with the growth of private house ownership in recent years they have become communities of some local importance.
Study undertaken by the class of 1W8, of Woodmill High School, Dunfermline.
